choices: The space-time geometry of the fivebrane theory.
The process of reducing the 6d (2,0) theory on M3.

multiple_choice_question.text: What concept does this figure illustrate?
choices: The structure of the S-matrix in 3-manifold homology.
The organization of critical points of the twisted superpotential W in 3d N=2 theories.
The difference between abelian and non-abelian flat connections.
The process of categorifying the superconformal index.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the different colored contours in this figure represent?
choices: The integration contours for computing the refined and unrefined Chern-Simons partition functions.
The different choices of boundary conditions for the 3d N=2 theory T[M3].
The Lefschetz thimbles associated with different flat connections.
The integration contours for computing the superconformal index and the unrefined partition function of T[M3] on D2 x S1.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the relationship between the two objects depicted in this figure?
choices: The plumbing graph on the left represents the resolution graph of the singularity whose link is shown on the right.
The plumbing graph on the left defines a 3-manifold that can be constructed by performing a Dehn surgery on the link of unknots shown on the right.
The link on the right is the mirror image of the link defined by the plumbing graph on the left.
The plumbing graph on the left and the link on the right represent different ways of describing the same knot.
The different types of line operators that can be inserted into the 3d N=2 theory T[M3].
The different ways to obtain the Lagrangian description of the theory T[M3].
The 3d Kirby moves that relate plumbing graphs corresponding to homeomorphic 3-manifolds.
The action of Wilson loops on the homological blocks.
The process of cabling the unknot.
The action of Wilson loops on the homological blocks.
The relation between knot homology and homology of cablings.
Braid representations of cables of the unknot with framing 1.
